translations.text: By the star when it sets:<sup foot_note="181694">1</sup>
your companion<sup foot_note="181695">1</sup> has neither strayed nor is he deluded;<sup foot_note="181696">2</sup>
nor does he speak out of his desire.
This is nothing but a revelation that is conveyed to him,<sup foot_note="181697">1</sup>
something that a very powerful one has imparted to him,<sup foot_note="181698">1</sup>
one endowed with immense wisdom.<sup foot_note="181699">1</sup> He came forth and stood poised,
being on the higher horizon.<sup foot_note="181700">1</sup>
Then he drew near and hung above suspended,
until he was two bows' length away, or nearer.<sup foot_note="181701">1</sup>
Then he revealed to Allah's servant whatever he had to reveal.<sup foot_note="181702">1</sup>
His heart added no untruth to what he saw.<sup foot_note="181703">1</sup>
Are you, then, going to contend with him regarding what he sees with his eyes?
Indeed he saw him a second time,
by the lote-tree at the farthest boundary,
near which is the Garden of Abode.<sup foot_note="181704">1</sup>
(This was) when the lote-tree was covered with that which covered it. <sup foot_note="181705">1</sup>
His eye did not waver, nor did it stray,<sup foot_note="181706">1</sup>
and he certainly saw some of the greatest Signs of His Lord.<sup foot_note="181707">1</sup>
Have you ever thought about al-Lat and al-Uzza,<sup foot_note="181708">1</sup>
and about the third deity, al-Manat?
Shall you have the male issues, and He the female issues?<sup foot_note="181709">1</sup>
That is indeed an unfair division!

These are nothing but names that you and your forefathers have invented, for which Allah has sent down no authority.<sup foot_note="181710">1</sup> They are merely following their conjectures and their carnal desires<sup foot_note="181711">2</sup> although guidance has come to them from their Lord.<sup foot_note="181712">3</sup>
Does man imagine that whatever he wishes for is right for him?<sup foot_note="181713">1</sup>
To Allah belong both the Next World and the present.

Numerous are the angels in the heavens; yet their intercession shall be of no avail, except in regard to those whom He grants the leave of intercession and whose plea He is pleased to accept.<sup foot_note="181714">1</sup>
Those who do not believe in the Hereafter give angels the names of females,<sup foot_note="181715">1</sup>
although they have no knowledge regarding that. They only follow their conjecture<sup foot_note="181716">1</sup> and conjecture can never take the place of the Truth.
So leave alone those who turn away from the remembrance of Us<sup foot_note="181717">1</sup> and who seek nothing but the life of the world<sup foot_note="181718">2</sup> –

that<sup foot_note="181719">1</sup> being the utmost of their knowledge.<sup foot_note="181720">2</sup> Surely your Lord fully knows those who have strayed away from His Path and He also fully knows those who are rightly guided.

To Allah alone belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth.<sup foot_note="181721">1</sup> He will<sup foot_note="181722">2</sup> requite the evil-doers for their deeds and bestow a goodly reward on those who have done good,

on those who avoid grave sins<sup foot_note="181723">1</sup> and shameful deeds,<sup foot_note="181724">2</sup> even if they may sometimes stumble into lesser offences.<sup foot_note="181725">3</sup> Surely your Lord is abounding in His Forgiveness.<sup foot_note="181726">4</sup> Very well is He aware of you since He produced you from the earth, and while you were still in your mothers' wombs and not yet born. So do not boastfully claim yourselves to be purified. He fully knows those that are truly Godfearing.
(O Prophet), did you see him who turned away (from the Path of Allah),
who gave a little, and then stopped?<sup foot_note="181727">1</sup>
Does he have any knowledge of the world beyond the ken of sense-perception, and therefore, clearly sees (the Truth)?<sup foot_note="181728">1</sup>
Has he not been informed of what is in the Scrolls of Moses,
and of Abraham, who lived up to the trust?<sup foot_note="181729">1</sup>
“That no bearer of a burden shall bear the burden of another,<sup foot_note="181730">1</sup>
and that man shall have nothing but what he has striven for,<sup foot_note="181731">1</sup>
and that (the result of) his striving shall soon be seen,<sup foot_note="181732">1</sup>
and that he shall then be fully recompensed,
and that the final end is with your Lord,
and that He it is Who causes people to laugh and to cry,<sup foot_note="181733">1</sup>
and that He it is Who causes death and grants life,
and He it is Who created the two kinds, the male and the female,
from a drop of sperm when it was emitted,<sup foot_note="181734">1</sup>
and that it is for Him to grant the second life,<sup foot_note="181735">1</sup>
that He it is Who bestowed wealth and riches,<sup foot_note="181736">1</sup>
that He is the Lord of Sirius,<sup foot_note="181737">1</sup>
that He it is Who destroyed the ancient 'Ad,<sup foot_note="181738">1</sup>
and Thamud, leaving no trace of them,
and that He it is Who destroyed the people of Noah before for they were much given to iniquity and transgression.
And He brought perdition upon the subverted cities
and caused them to be covered with that which He covered them with.<sup foot_note="181739">1</sup>
So,<sup foot_note="181740">1</sup> which of your Lord's bounties will you doubt?”<sup foot_note="181741">2</sup>
This is a warning among the warnings of yore.<sup foot_note="181742">1</sup>
The imminent Hour has drawn near,<sup foot_note="181743">1</sup>
and none but Allah can avert it.<sup foot_note="181744">1</sup>
Will you, then, wonder at this?<sup foot_note="181745">1</sup>
Will you laugh at it rather than weep?<sup foot_note="181746">1</sup>
Will you occupy yourselves simply in merriment?<sup foot_note="181747">1</sup>
Prostrate yourselves before Allah, and serve Him.<sup foot_note="181748">1</sup>
